tier.item: a. John-wa Bill-o osi-taosi-ta koto-wa osi-taosi-ta kedo
In Hale and Keyser (1993: 76) the D-structure and S-structure of an unergative verb contain a true external
argument, appearing in the Spec position of the functional projection of IP. Following this, we can say that
John is the external argument of V1 at D-structure, whereas it is the internal argument of V2 and it moves to
the Spec position of IP at S-structure.
Top Acc push-topple-Perf fact-Top push-topple-Perf but
'John did push and toppled Bill, but ...'
a. John-wa Bill-o osi-taosi-ta koto-wa osi-taosi-ta kedo
